review: a scifi tower defense that is definitely not as bad as some may describe it get ready to defend your compounds against all sorts of monsters both big and small different beasts means different weapons and tools that will be needed to destroy them all plenty of options to mix and match although some strategies are admittedly better than others plenty of challenge and a solid enough design to get a good score from me give it a shoot if you like tower defense

this fastpaced tower defense builds on rts researchdriven mechanics with a retro visual style that still feels modern  the onscreen artifacts and frenetic pace of each level make for exciting gameplay  clickanddrag to build several of the same building in whatever pattern the pointer moves sell buildings in the same manner  interactions between campaign levels allow for advances in research  my favorite part is the dialogue with the stellar voice acting
